title: Camp Snap Camera V2
content:
The Camp Snap Camera is a stripped back, minimal digital camera inspired by the disposable cameras of the 1980s and 1990s. Its plastic lens gives the photos a unique quality, unique in today’s razor-sharp glass found on mirrorless systems, while offering a true-to-form photographic experience. Simply point and shoot. The Camp Snap V2 was just announced, so let’s take a closer look….

This is v2 of the Camp Snap Camera! It features a significantly faster shutter, more refined jpeg processing, ability to set date and time for metadata, ability to adjust sound level, and strap lugs (strap not included).

No more chimping over the day’s photos at camp being anti-social or looking to make sure your focus was dead-on in that last action shot. With the Camp Snap Camera, it’s one and done.

With just a shutter button and a flash selector switch, the Camp Snap Camera is designed for easy, point-and-shoot operation. There are no complicated settings and menus – capture memorable moments with absolute ease.

Designed with camping trips and coffee shop walks in mind, the Camp Snap Camera is lightweight and compact.

  • What’s in the box: Camp Snap Camera, USB-C cable, 4gb memory card included
  • Sensor: 8 megapixels, 1/3.2″
  • White Balance:  Auto. I like adjusting white balance in post (using Lightroom, Photoshop, or Gimp [free]) to get the colors just right.
  • Camera Size: 4.5″ x 2.5″ x 1″
  • Flash Settings: On, Off, Auto
  • File Type: JPG
  • Weight: 92g

Operation:

  • On/off: Hold shutter button for 2 seconds to turn the camera on and off – you will hear a 2 and 1 audible beeps, respectively
  • Take photo: Press the shutter once and you’ll hear the shutter sound
  • Flash: Slide the selector between On, Off, and Auto
  • Importing photos: Turn on the camera, insert USB-C into the camera’s port and into your computer or smart phone, and drag and drop

 

Velo Orange stocks the Camp Snap V2 Camera, along with a variety of bags that can carry it.
